worklogs.comment:
vibhatha opened a new pull request, #13713:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13713

   This PR re-organizes the streaming execution engine documentation. 
   Created sub-pages and partitioned the exampels so that the reading is more comfortable. 
   Also splitted the overview section, substrait and examples in different sub-sections. 
   
   Note: This effort only re-organized the structure not the content.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13713:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13713#issuecomment-1195698594

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

vibhatha commented on PR #13713:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13713#issuecomment-1197635413

   cc @lidavidm @pitrou @ianmcook @wjones127 @westonpace 
   Organized the documentation to an extent. It needs more work on the content. 
   There is a follow up PR for that. Merely organized the content for readability and easy browsing.

vibhatha closed pull request #13713: ARROW-17177: [C++][Docs] Re-Organize the Existing Acero Streaming Engine Documentation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13713

   This PR includes a documentation update on reorganizing Acero documentation.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14185#discussion_r981387373

##########
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@

+*****
+Acero
+*****
+
+.. toctree::
+   :maxdepth: 3
+
+   acero/overview

Review Comment:
   Putting the overview in its entirety, including how to make an ExecPlan, before discussing Substrait increases the risk that a user will use an ExecPlan by hand instead of using Substrait as a helper layer. Could overview be broken up further, and one part put before Substrait and one after? 
   
   Really, it seems what's necessary is a good example of using Substrait to make one of these trees

Review Comment:
   I see your point here. I totally understand that. I think we definitely need to re-write what we offer carefully since Substrait came into the picture. I am planning to work on that piece separately. And before doing that, I thought it is better clean up the documentation strucutre. A while back I created this [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17210) to address this point. At that time I assumed that this has to be done at a certain point. But Substrait adoption in Acero wasn't matured enough to write a good documentation. But we have improved since that Jira was created.
   
   Shall we address this issue in that JIRA (I can create it righ after re-organization is merged) and just keep the re-organization piece in this PR? WDYT?
   
   cc @westonpace

vibhatha commented on PR #14185:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14185#issuecomment-1261878980

   cc @westonpace @lidavidm could you please take a look at the re-structured content?

fields.description:
The current document is too-length. By creating sub-pages for each example and explain the code and provide a better description, that would be much better in terms of readability and browsing the content. The idea is to create a sub-folder in the examples called 'acero` and include each example in a separate `.cc` file. This is the code change. Following this, the documentation page on the website can be splitted into sub-pages. This is the only change suggested for this sub-task. 

There is already a JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16802 to improve the internal content. So it would be used for re-writing the contnet.
fields.summary: [C++][Docs] Re-Organize the Existing Acero Streaming Engine Documentation

comments.body: Linking related JIRAs for improving Acero documentation and updating the overview of components and layers

Decided to keep the original example in a single `.cc` file rather than splitting it. But documentation is formatted and organized better. There is a separate effort to improve the content for each example.
